source_sentence: 聞如是：一時，佛在王舍城靈鷲山中，與大比丘眾俱、比丘五百、菩薩八千，一切大聖神通已達，已逮總持辯才無礙，獲無所畏得不起忍，奉無數佛殖眾德本，皆志大乘至不退轉，弘無蓋哀救濟十方。
translation: Thus I have heard: One time, the Buddha was in the city of Rājagṛha on Vulture Peak with a great assembly of monks, 500 monks, and 8,000 bodhisattvas, all of whom had attained the superknowledge of great sages, had acquired the unimpeded eloquence of the dhāraṇī, had attained the fearlessness and patience of not rising, and had consecrated an incalculable collection of buddha virtues, all of whom were dedicated to the great vehicle, reaching irreversibility, and were of unsurpassed compassionate salvation in ten directions.

source_sentence: 其名曰空無菩薩、持土菩薩、持人菩薩、持祠身菩薩、觀意菩薩、淨意菩薩、上意菩薩、信樂意菩薩、持意菩薩、增念意菩薩、喜見菩薩、善見菩薩、可意見菩薩、普利可見菩薩、彌勒菩薩、普及一切賢劫菩薩，咸來集會悉共俱坐。
translation: Their names were Emptiness and Nothingness Bodhisattva, Earth-holding Bodhisattva, People-holding Bodhisattva, Shrine-Body-holding Bodhisattva, Contemplation Bodhisattva, Pure-Minded Bodhisattva, Superior-Minded Bodhisattva, Faithful and Likely Bodhisattva, Mindfulness Bodhisattva, Joyful View Bodhisattva, Well-Seeing Bodhisattva, Wishable View Bodhisattva, Universally Beneficial Visible Bodhisattva, Maitreya Bodhisattva, and Pervasive All Good Eons Bodhisattva, who all assembled and sat together.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊在王舍城開化一國，國王、大臣、百官群僚、長者、梵志、凡庶人民，僉共一心奉事供養，衣被、飲食、醫藥、床臥，一切所安莫不欣然。
translation: At the time, the Bhagavān was in Rājagṛha to found a country, and the king, his ministers, a hundred officials, officials, elders, priests, and common people all served and supported him with one mind, wearing clothing, eating, drinking, administering medicine, lying on beds, and making every kind of comfort possible.

source_sentence: 於時賢者須菩提，明旦著衣持鉢，欲行分衛，未入城門。
translation: Good man Subhūti then put on his robe and bowl at sunrise, intending to go on a journey to Bimbisāra, before entering the city gates.

source_sentence: 行詣佛所，稽首足下，退住一面，前白佛言：「唯然，大聖！
translation: He went to the Buddha, bowed his head at his feet, withdrew to one side, and said to the Buddha, "Yes, great sage!

source_sentence: 我夜臥寐夢中見已，坐佛樹下而見如來，稽首足下，遷住一面。
translation: After I saw it in a dream while lying in bed at night, I sat under a buddha tree and saw the Tathāgata, bowed my head at my feet, and moved to one side.

source_sentence: 時佛以紫金色手摩我頂上，頒宣斯言而告於我：『今日，須菩提！
translation: The Buddha then put his purple-golden hand on my head, declared these words to me, and told me, 'Today, Subhūti!

source_sentence: 當得逮聞古昔已來所未聞法。』
translation: He will then be able to hear a teaching that has never been heard since ancient times.'

source_sentence: 唯聖垂愍敢說此意，是則何等先之瑞應？」
translation: May the noble one have mercy on us and dare to explain this idea, for what would be the prior auspicious response?"

source_sentence: 佛告須菩提：「有法典名曰順權方便，諸族姓子及族姓女所宜奉行，以斯比像先現瑞應，仁當逮聞未曾有法。」
translation: The Buddha told Subhūti, "There's a scripture called 'expedient methods of according authority' that clansmen sons and clanswomen should practice, and because this is a portentous image that has previously appeared, you will surely hear of a teaching that has never existed before."

source_sentence: 時須菩提前白佛言：「我今欲入王舍大城，因行分衛。」
translation: Suppository then went forward and said to the Buddha, "Now, I want to enter the great city of Rājagṛha because I'm doing my part to guard it."

source_sentence: 佛言：「從意順時無違道節，善哉！
translation: The Buddha said, "It's good to follow your heart and not disobey the rules of the path.

source_sentence: 行矣！」
translation: It's done!"

source_sentence: 時須菩提，見佛聽之，入城分衛，普行求食。
translation: Seeing and hearing the Buddha, Subhūti went into his part of the city and went out to seek food.

source_sentence: 尋到諸家貴姓、長者、梵志，因入其舍，在門中庭默然而住。
translation: He found noble families, elders, and priests, so he entered their homes and stayed there in the courtyard at the entrance in silence.

source_sentence: 時長者家有一女人，普莊嚴身珠璣瓔珞服栴檀香，以紫金寶文飾其體，端正姝好威發晃昱，光澤第一淨如蓮華，從其室出，問須菩提：「賢者！
translation: At the time, there was a woman in the house of the elder who had a richly adorned body of beads, jewelry, and sandalwood, whose body was adorned with purple-gold jewelry, was beautiful and graceful, and whose radiance was first and purest like a lotus, and she emerged from her room and asked Subhūti, "Good man!

source_sentence: 何緣住門中庭？」
translation: What is the reason for living in the courtyard at the entrance?"

source_sentence: 須菩提報曰：「姊欲知之，故來分衛。」
translation: Subhūti replied, "You wanted to know about it, so you came to Defender's Corner."

source_sentence: 其女答曰：「今須菩提，故復懷抱分衛想乎？
translation: The woman replied, "Supposititious, is that why you're harboring the idea of being a part-keeper?

source_sentence: 斷思食耶？」
translation: Is it possible to stop thinking about food?"

source_sentence: 須菩提答曰：「姊欲知之，食想已斷，又有是身父母遺體，在胞胎中飲食養之，而至成長，習之來久不可離食。」
translation: Subhūti answered, "You want to know that you've stopped thinking about food and that you have the remains of your parents who were in your womb, fed, and grew up, and you've been accustomed to it for a long time and can't part with it."

source_sentence: 女又問曰：「須菩提賢者！
translation: The woman also asked, "Good man, Subhūti!

source_sentence: 未斷生死眾行故，有終始愁慼，悲泣不可意，傷不造證乎？」
translation: Does it not hurt to realize that because you haven't yet ended the many courses of birth and death, you have beginning and end sorrow and lamentation that's unattractive?"

source_sentence: 須菩提答曰：「已造證矣，身口心寂。」
translation: Subhūti replied, "Having realized it, the body, speech, and mind are quiescent."

source_sentence: 又問：「賢者為滅身乎？」
translation: He also asked, "Good man, is this the cessation of the body?"

source_sentence: 須菩提答曰：「其滅度者無有身也，法無所除，亦無道行。」
translation: Suppository answered, "He who is liberated has no body, no dharmas to remove, and no practices of the path."

source_sentence: 女又問曰：「若使諸法皆無滅除無所行者，賢者須菩提云何捨身而分衛乎？
translation: The woman also asked, "If all things lacked cessation and had nothing to practice, then how would Subhūti, the good man, abandon himself to defend them?

source_sentence: 安和成就也？」
translation: What has been accomplished in this way?"

source_sentence: 須菩提答曰：「其滅定者當普觀之，休息興立，興立顯身亦復非造。」
translation: Suppository replied, "Those who are in the concentration of cessation should be observed universally, resting and standing up, and the body that appears to be standing up is no longer created."

source_sentence: 女又問曰：「其滅定者，所在定行則不滅度？」
translation: The woman also asked, "Does that cessation of concentration mean that where he is in concentrated practice, he doesn't cease to exist?"

source_sentence: 答：「以滅定則無所生，亦無所滅。」
translation: He answered, "With the concentration of cessation, nothing is produced and nothing is extinguished."

source_sentence: 女又問曰：「若無所生、無所滅者，云何賢者，離身分衛不以安和？」
translation: The woman also asked, "If there's nothing that arises and nothing that ceases, how is it that a good man who parts with his body and guards it doesn't use it to make peace?"

source_sentence: 須菩提答曰：「如來聲聞行分衛時，為捨身耶！」
translation: Suppository answered, "When the śrāvakas practiced their part in guarding, did they abandon themselves?"

source_sentence: 女又問曰：「佛歎賢者於聲聞中行空第一，空有處耶？」
translation: The woman also asked, "Does the Buddha praise you for being the best among śrāvakas in practicing emptiness, or is there a place for emptiness?"

source_sentence: 須菩提答曰：「然，如姊來言。」
translation: Subhūti replied, "Yes, just as you said."

source_sentence: 女又問曰：「其所行空豈往反乎？」
translation: The woman also asked, "Does he practice emptiness and go against it?"

source_sentence: 須菩提答曰：「其行空者無有往反。」
translation: Subhūti answered, "They practice emptiness without going back and forth."

source_sentence: 女又問曰：「假使空行無有往反，賢者何故周旋行來，而分衛乎？」
translation: The woman also asked, "If the practice of emptiness has no going or coming, why does that good man go around, practice, and defend himself?"

source_sentence: 須菩提答曰：「雖行分衛，不貪養身，欲以休息痛痒苦故，而行分衛也。」
translation: Suppository replied, "Even though they practice self-defense, they don't crave nurturing themselves; they want to practice self-defense because they want to rest from pain and itching."

source_sentence: 女又問曰：「賢者復有痛痒懷惱眾難厄乎？」
translation: The woman also asked, "Good man, does he still have pain and itching, and does he harbor many difficulties and hardships?"

source_sentence: 須菩提答曰：「無痛痒不懷眾難，又欲休息飢虛痛痒，故行分衛。」
translation: Suppository answered, "I don't harbor many difficulties without pain and itch, and I want to rest from hunger and deficiency pain and itch, so I practice partial defense."

source_sentence: 其女問曰：「賢者今行不等空業。
translation: The woman asked, "Good man, you're now engaged in unequal activity in emptiness.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 其行空者不以痛痒而為苦患，一切三界無所有故；又行空者不猗身心，不生念身心，亦無所染無樂不樂，其行空者悉無諸法，乃處閑居。」
translation: He who practices emptiness doesn't make pain and itchiness a painful or painful experience; it's because all three realms lack existence; he practices emptiness without agitation or mindfulness of body and mind, without defilement or pleasure, and without discomfort; he practices emptiness in which all dharmas are absent and he lives in seclusion."

source_sentence: 女又問曰：「賢者處在閑居行空第一，以何等故名曰空閑？」
translation: The woman also asked, "Good man, when you live in a peaceful place and practice emptiness first, what is the reason you call that emptiness?"

source_sentence: 須菩提答曰：「所以曰空，不以因緣捨欲眾塵，乃曰閑居。」
translation: Subhūti replied, "It's called emptiness because it's not based on causes and conditions to abandon desires for the many dust motes that are called living in seclusion."

source_sentence: 女又問曰：「其行空者捨貪欲乎？」
translation: The woman also asked, "Does someone who practices emptiness abandon craving?"

source_sentence: 須菩提答曰：「其行空者不捨貪欲耶！」
translation: Subhūti replied, "Does he practice emptiness and not abandon desire?"

source_sentence: 女又問曰：「云何捨欲名曰行空？」
translation: The woman also asked, "What is the name given to the practice of emptiness when one abandons desire?"

source_sentence: 須菩提答曰：「所可說者，是假言辭。」
translation: Subhūti answered, "What can be explained is nominal."

source_sentence: 又問：「賢者行空，豈有辭乎？
translation: He also asked, "Good man, when he practices emptiness, does he have words?

source_sentence: 而仁說之。」
translation: And a kind person teaches it."

source_sentence: 須菩提答曰：「假託辭耳，賢聖聲聞本之言教也。」
translation: Suppository replied, "Pretending to be rhetorical, the noble śrāvakas originally taught by their words."

source_sentence: 女又問曰：「咨嗟言辭，心存言辭則墮顛倒，其墮顛倒則處諍訟，其處諍訟則非沙門不應法義。」
translation: The woman also asked, "When you sigh with admiration and talk, the mind is distracted by talk, and when it's distracted by talk, it's in dispute, and when it's in dispute, it's not the meaning of the teachings that ascetics shouldn't have."

source_sentence: 須菩提問姊：「何謂名曰沙門法義？」
translation: Subhūti asked the sister, "What's the meaning of the term ascetic?"

source_sentence: 其女答曰：「無有言辭乃沙門法，若無言辭則無顛倒，無顛倒者則無諍訟，無諍訟者是沙門法；所致法者永離二行，乃謂一法謂沙門法，無想不想永寂眾想，乃謂沙門；無為無散遠離合散，超越邪迹入平等道，謂沙門法；無有境土離於分界無為滅度，謂沙門法；以知止足不貪道俗，永無所著坦然無迹，謂沙門法；無著無縛亦無有脫等猶虛空，謂沙門法；亦無心念除心意識，謂沙門法；常知節限，少欲少事無所悕望，謂沙門法。
translation: 其女答曰：「無有言辭乃沙門法，若無言辭則無顛倒，無顛倒者則無諍訟，無諍訟者是沙門法；所致法者永離二行，乃謂一法謂沙門法，無想不想永寂眾想，乃謂沙門；無為無散遠離合散，超越邪迹入平等道，謂沙門法；無有境土離於分界無為滅度，謂沙門法；以知止足不貪道俗，永無所著坦然無迹，謂沙門法；無著無縛亦無有脫等猶虛空，謂沙門法；亦無心念除心意識，謂沙門法；常知節限，少欲少事無所悕望，謂沙門法。

source_sentence: 「消去貪欲心無所慕，志若太山不可傾動，謂沙門法；棄捨欲樂心不虛渴不好三界，謂沙門法；皆離分界十方境土，越諸所作無所起立，謂沙門法；捨五陰魔及其形體，無有眾難無有塵勞，謂沙門法；越度魔界貪欲所消，心無所生亦不馳逸，謂沙門法；以超死魔而無所著不懷妄想，謂沙門法；不慕天魔心無所思志等如地，謂沙門法。
translation: "To cease craving and have no longing for anything, with a mind like Mt. Tai that's unshakeable, is an ascetic; to abandon desire and pleasure, have a mind that's not in vain and thirsty, and doesn't abide in the three realms is an ascetic; to be free of the ten realms and ten directions, transcending all actions and having nothing to build is an ascetic; to abandon the five aggregates and Māra and their bodies, having no difficulties and no dust and trouble is an ascetic; to transcend the Māra realm and have craving cease, having nothing to give rise to in the mind and not being dissipated is an ascetic; to transcend the Māra of death without attachment and without harboring deluded notions is an ascetic; to not long for the Māras of heaven and have a mind that's free of thought and a will that's equal to the ground is an ascetic.

source_sentence: 「不著吾我解一切空寂然淡泊，謂沙門法；心無所猗以無想行而不增損，謂沙門法；以捨妄想心無所願不有取捨，謂沙門法；遊在三界而無所行決眾疑網，謂沙門法；消眾入無無有諸衰陰蓋永滅，謂沙門法；捨于調戲不存放逸降伏其心，謂沙門法；不抱瞋恚心不懷恨寂寞定意，謂沙門法；無有飢渴不存虛乏心無合會，謂沙門法；無有二行已捨二業而等同像，不高不卑不舉不下，謂沙門法。
translation: "To be unattached to self and to understand all emptiness, quiescent and indifferent is the ascetic teaching; to mind unencumbered by anything and behaving without thoughts and not add to or subtract from it is the ascetic teaching; to abandon deluded thoughts and mind with no desires and without taking or leaving anything is the ascetic teaching; to wander in the three realms with nothing to do and resolve the web of doubt is the ascetic teaching; to subdue the hindrances of decay and disappearance in the masses is the ascetic teaching; to abandon agitation and not store up carelessness and subdue the mind is the ascetic teaching; to not harbor anger and not harbor hatred, loneliness, and concentration is the ascetic teaching; to have no hunger or thirst and not store up a vacant mind with no conjunction is the ascetic teaching; to have no two actions and abandon two karmas and become like an image, not high or low, not raised or lowered is the ascetic teaching.

source_sentence: 「以棄兩事行無所著無所罣礙，謂沙門法；斷除俗業却眾陰蔽不貪四大，謂沙門法；分別五陰諸種本末無有諸入，謂沙門法；頒宣一切十方法界無有境土，謂沙門法；曉了諸入自然如化本無處所，謂沙門法；自然如空而暢無為不好有為，謂沙門法；永以棄去一切諸數無有取捨，謂沙門法；自於己利而知止足不有諍訟，謂沙門法；和心一切顯現眾生等行忍辱，謂沙門法；無所亡失心不忘捨逮得解脫，謂沙門法；心已解脫而無所怙坦然寂寞，謂沙門法；猶若虛空不可譬喻等無有侶，謂沙門法。」
translation: 「以棄兩事行無所著無所罣礙，謂沙門法；斷除俗業却眾陰蔽不貪四大，謂沙門法；分別五陰諸種本末無有諸入，謂沙門法；頒宣一切十方法界無有境土，謂沙門法；曉了諸入自然如化本無處所，謂沙門法；自然如空而暢無為不好有為，謂沙門法；永以棄去一切諸數無有取捨，謂沙門法；自於己利而知止足不有諍訟，謂沙門法；和心一切顯現眾生等行忍辱，謂沙門法；無所亡失心不忘捨逮得解脫，謂沙門法；心已解脫而無所怙坦然寂寞，謂沙門法；猶若虛空不可譬喻等無有侶，謂沙門法。」

source_sentence: 女說於是行沙門法時，諸天子等集會門庭，四十天子遠塵離垢得法眼淨，五百天子舉聲歎曰：「篤信微妙聞於上法至心和雅。」
translation: When the woman said she was thus practicing the ascetic teachings, the sons of gods and others gathered in the courtyard, 40 sons of gods became dustless and spotless and attained purification of the Dharma eye, and 500 sons of gods raised their voices and praised, "Devoutly faithful and subtle, they hear the above teaching and attain harmony of mind and elegance."

source_sentence: 悉發無上正真道意。
translation: They all aroused the intention for the unsurpassed true path.

translation: The Second Chapter of the Vision of the Truth

source_sentence: 爾時，賢者須菩提而口歎曰：「至未曾有！
translation: It was then that the good man Subhūti praised him, saying, "Never has it been!

source_sentence: 是姊辯才慧明巍巍，所頒宣法音聲和雅必佛威神，將是如來所化不疑。」
translation: Your eloquence, wisdom, and insight are so lofty that the sounds and voices of the teachings you proclaim must be the Buddha's authoritative power, and there's no doubt that they're being transformed by the Tathāgata."

source_sentence: 於時彼女知須菩提心念本末，報須菩提：「如今賢者所識察之，其沙門法離於分界無有境土，無著無縛亦無所脫。
translation: Knowing the origin and derivative of Suppository's thoughts, the woman then reported to Suppository, "Now, that good man's consciousness examines an ascetic's teaching that's free of discriminating elements, has no objects or lands, is unattached, unfettered, and has nothing to liberate.

source_sentence: 心自念言：『必如來化。』
translation: He thinks to himself, 'I'm sure he'll be like the Tathāgata who converted him.'

source_sentence: 誠如所云，今吾觀身如來所化，現作女像悉了本無。
translation: As it turns out, I now see myself transformed by the Tathāgata, and I now create an image of a woman that fully understands that she originally existed.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 如來、至真解暢本無，吾身本無等無有異，由是之故如來所化。
translation: "The Tathāgata and the Zhizhen Jiechang originally had nothing, and my body originally had nothing, and so there's no difference; therefore, what the Tathāgata produces is the result of that.

source_sentence: 如如來色本無，我色本無，無二亦復然矣，以是之故，如來所化。
translation: Just as the Tathāgata's form is originally nonexistent and my form is originally nonexistent, so too is there no difference, and it's because of this that the Tathāgata is transformed.

source_sentence: 痛痒行識皆為本無，五陰本同自然無際悉為本無，以是之故，如來所化。
translation: Pain, itch, volition, and consciousness are all originally nonexistent, and the five aggregates are all originally the same in their natural lack of limit; therefore, they are transformed by the Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 如來本無，一切眾生其元本無，諸聖本無吾身本無等無有異，以故名曰如來所化。
translation: The Tathāgata's originally nonexistent, the origin of all sentient beings is originally nonexistent, and the origin of the sages is originally nonexistent in our bodies, and so on, without any difference; therefore, they're called created by the Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 如來本無，一切諸法亦復本無，一切道義亦復本無，身亦復本無身同然，以是之故，如來所化。
translation: Since the Tathāgata is originally nonexistent, all dharmas are also originally nonexistent, all path meanings are also originally nonexistent, and the body is also originally nonexistent in itself, and so it's called what the Tathāgata transforms.

source_sentence: 如來本無悉無所生無有處所，如來本無悉無所生亦無所滅，吾身本無不起不滅。
translation: The Tathāgata is originally nonexistent, so there's nothing that arises and no place, and the Tathāgata is originally nonexistent, so our body is originally nonexistent and doesn't cease.

source_sentence: 以是之故，如來所化。
translation: Because of this, the Tathāgata is transformed.

source_sentence: 如來本空一切如幻，吾身本無本無同然，本空不起不滅，以是之故，如來所化。
translation: The Tathāgata is originally empty and everything is illusory, and our body is originally nothing and originally nonexistent in the same way, originally empty, neither rising nor falling into extinction; therefore, it's created by the Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 如來所化一切本無，一切眾生本無處所諸法本無，其本審諦真實本無，等無有異悉虛無形。
translation: All that the Tathāgata transforms are originally nonexistent, all sentient beings originally have no place, and all dharmas are originally nonexistent, their original truths are truly nonexistent, and they are equally, without exception, completely void of form.

source_sentence: 又，須菩提！
translation: Again, Subhūti!

source_sentence: 舉要言之，一切諸法皆住本無，吾以是故如來所化。」
translation: To summarize, all things that exist abide in their original nonexistence, and it's because of this that the Tathāgata transforms them."

source_sentence: 時須菩提問其女言：「云何？
translation: Suppository then asked his daughter, "What is it?

source_sentence: 今姊以佛聖威知我心念？
translation: Now, you know my thoughts by the Buddha's noble authority?

source_sentence: 為以己明見之耶？」
translation: Why do you see it with your own insight?"

source_sentence: 其女答曰：「今須菩提能知他人眾生心所念乎！
translation: The woman replied, "Now, can Subhūti know what other sentient beings are thinking in their minds?

source_sentence: 聲聞、緣覺、諸菩薩眾，五通仙人、外學異法，皆佛威神而有所知。
translation: śrāvakas, pratyekbuddhas, the bodhisattva community, the five sages with supernormal powers, and those who have studied different dharmas from outside the world all have knowledge of the Buddha's authority.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 一切應時從佛受教。
translation: "All the time, they should receive instruction from the Buddha.

source_sentence: 如今尊者須菩提，知於他人眾生心念，以是之故，亦佛威神而能知之。
translation: Now, Venerable Subhūti knows the thoughts of other sentient beings, and because of that, even the Buddha's authoritative power can know them.

source_sentence: 猶如天下一切眾生，因以日月大炬燈火，十方眾焰諸有光明緣覩諸色。
translation: It's like all the sentient beings under the heavens who see forms by the light of the sun and moon, a great torch, and the many flames and lights in the ten directions.

source_sentence: 如是，須菩提！
translation: Thus, Subhūti!

source_sentence: 諸佛弟子見眾生心照以聖慧，消愚癡冥使逮道明，皆佛威神。」
translation: All Buddha disciples see the minds of sentient beings and illuminate them with noble wisdom, which eliminates delusion and enables them to acquire insight into the path, and it's all the Buddha's authoritative power."

source_sentence: 於時，賢者須菩提謂其女曰：「唯為我說，今女為誰從何而來，乃有此辯？」
translation: At the time, the good man Subhūti said to his daughter, "Only tell me, 'Who is this woman and where did she come from that you've given this explanation?'"

source_sentence: 女答須菩提：「假使有人問如來化：『今汝為誰？
translation: The woman answered Subhūti, "Suppose someone asks the Tathāgata about the transformation, 'Who are you now?'

source_sentence: 從何而來？』
translation: Where did it come from?'

source_sentence: 於時化佛以何發遣？」
translation: What did the transformation buddha do at the time to dispel it?"

source_sentence: 須菩提答曰：「無所發遣。」
translation: Subhūti replied, "There's nothing to send."

source_sentence: 其女答曰：「如是，須菩提！
translation: The woman replied, "So it is, Subhūti!

source_sentence: 其化自然解諸法相，一切如是亦無所知。」
translation: He naturally understands the characteristics of all things as they are and doesn't know them."

source_sentence: 女又問曰：「今問仁者：『為有學業？
translation: The woman also asked, "Now, I'd like to ask you, sir, 'Is there training?'

source_sentence: 為是凡夫？
translation: Why are they worldlings?

source_sentence: 是羅漢乎？』
translation: Is this a arhat?'

source_sentence: 若作是問，以何答之？」
translation: If you ask this question, what is the answer?"

source_sentence: 須菩提答曰：「吾非學業，亦非凡夫，亦非羅漢。」
translation: Subhūti replied, "I'm not a trainee, an ordinary man, or a arhat."

source_sentence: 其女問曰：「今須菩提以心相倚而答我耶？」
translation: The woman asked, "Now, is Subhūti answering me with his mind leaning against me?"

source_sentence: 報曰：「如是。」
translation: He replied, "So it is."

source_sentence: 須菩提曰：「女何報我？」
translation: Subhūti said, "Why did the woman reward me?"

source_sentence: 女曰：「若深山中，間所呼聲乎？
translation: The woman said, "Suppose there's a sound deep in the mountains that's called out from time to time?

source_sentence: 以用心意而相答耶？」
translation: How can you answer with your mind?"

source_sentence: 答曰：「不也！
translation: They replied, "No!

source_sentence: 響因虛空而有其音。」
translation: It's a sound that arises from the sound of space."

source_sentence: 女曰：「如須菩提豈可逮致乎？
translation: The woman said, "Like Subhūti, how could it be possible to attain it?

source_sentence: 緣其法行得入道耶？
translation: By virtue of their practice of the Dharma, will they enter the Way?

source_sentence: 因立證明，成就道德而可處當也。
translation: Establishing proof by cause accomplishes morality and makes it possible to deal with it.

source_sentence: 音聲本無，吾我言辭亦復如是，悉亦本無。」
translation: As sound is originally nonexistent, so are my words and mine, all of which are originally nonexistent."

source_sentence: 時虛空中自然有音，歎於此辭。
translation: At the time, there was a natural sound in space that was praised as being this kind of speech.

source_sentence: 女說是言，令須菩提遙聞虛空自然之音，宣揚答曰：「向者仁言，吾非學業、亦非凡夫、亦非羅漢。
translation: The woman said these words, causing Suppository to hear the natural voice of space from a distance and proclaim in reply, "You kindly told me, 'I'm not a trainee, not a mere man, and not a arhat.

source_sentence: 行得執持何法，諸漏已盡至於等時，以致羅漢耶？」
translation: What teaching can I practice and maintain that will cause me to become a arhat when the contaminants have ended and I reach the same point?"

source_sentence: 須菩提答曰：「若如來化行得處所，我執持行其宜若斯！」
translation: Subhūti replied, "If the Tathāgata's transformation practices were to find a place, it would be appropriate for me to maintain the practices."

source_sentence: 其女答曰：「仁須菩提非羅漢乎？
translation: The woman replied, "Isn't Ren Subhūti a arhat?

source_sentence: 諸漏不盡耶？
translation: Are the contaminants not exhausted?

source_sentence: 佛歎仁者諸聲聞中行空第一。」
translation: The Buddha praised you, sir, as the best among śrāvakas in practicing emptiness."

source_sentence: 須菩提答曰：「吾非羅漢諸漏不盡，亦不行空不歎第一。」
translation: Subhūti replied, "I'm not a arhat whose contaminants aren't ended, and I don't praise you for practicing emptiness the most."

source_sentence: 女又問：「賢者心樂堪任，云何自誤而竊妄語？」
translation: The woman also asked, "Good man, why would you mislead yourself and steal falsehoods when your mind is so capable of handling them?"

source_sentence: 須菩提答曰：「假使我見智達諸法，已得羅漢眾漏已盡，世尊歎詠行空第一，爾乃我墮妄語兩舌。
translation: Supposing I saw and understood the Dharma, had attained arhatship, and had ended all the contaminants, and the Bhagavān praised me for practicing emptiness first, then I would fall into false speech and duplicity.

source_sentence: 我不知法、不覩所在，以是之故不為妄言，所言至誠。」
translation: I don't know the teaching and don't see what's there; therefore, I don't speak falsely and am perfectly sincere in what I say."

source_sentence: 女又問曰：「仁者須菩提！
translation: The woman also asked, "Sir, Subhūti!

source_sentence: 此諸天子，其見諦者來會門下聽受經法，謂仁不實？」
translation: Are these sons of gods who see the truth and come under the teaching to listen to the sūtras and receive the teaching considered benevolent or not true?"

source_sentence: 須菩提答曰：「其見諦者，諸天世人莫能欺者。」
translation: Subhūti answered, "No gods or humans can deceive him about the truth of his views."

source_sentence: 女又問曰：「賢者若有所見，為不至誠？」
translation: The woman also asked, "Good man, if you have a view, is it not perfectly sincere?"

source_sentence: 須菩提問曰：「其有所見為不諦乎？」
translation: Subhūti asked, "Does he see something as a false truth?"

source_sentence: 女曰：「其覩誠諦不可見也。」
translation: The woman said, "They see the true truth, but they can't see it."

source_sentence: 女又問曰：「耆年須菩提，能見真諦乎？」
translation: The woman also asked, "Aged Subhūti, can you see the true truth?"

source_sentence: 須菩提答曰：「假如女言，我悉不見欺詐之業，況復覩見至誠諦耶？
translation: Suppository replied, "Suppose a woman says, 'I haven't seen any deceptive activity, so how could I see the most sincere truth?'

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: What is the reason?

source_sentence: 一切皆空。」
translation: Everything is empty."

source_sentence: 於時須菩提謂其女曰：「所言至誠為何謂耶？」
translation: Suppository then asked his daughter, "What is this utmost sincerity that you speak of?"

source_sentence: 女答曰：「唯，須菩提！
translation: The woman replied, "Yes, Subhūti!

source_sentence: 所云至誠，於一切法悉無所生，其見誠者則覩顛倒。」
translation: What's called supreme sincerity is that nothing arises from any dharmas, and those who see sincerity then see delusion."

source_sentence: 須菩提問女：「為誰說斯如是言教？」
translation: Subhūti asked the woman, "For whom did he teach this kind of discourse?"

source_sentence: 其女答曰：「唯，須菩提！
translation: The woman replied, "Yes, Subhūti!

source_sentence: 處在顛倒，不起塵勞、不起見諦，乃為真諦，以覩在倒不見真諦。」
translation: To be in error and not experience dust and trouble and not see the truth is the true truth, and to behold error and not see the true truth."

source_sentence: 時諸天子會在門下者，覩其女身微妙之業，則稽首女，禮須菩提，口宣斯言：「聞須菩提親覩此女，聽其辯才。」
translation: When the gods assembled under the gate saw the woman's subtle physical actions, they looked up at her, paid homage to Subhūti, and proclaimed, "I've heard that Subhūti personally saw this woman and listened to her eloquence."

source_sentence: 各自歎曰：「為得善利無極之慶，若聞是教篤信愛樂亦復難遇，況復好喜而奉行者，德不可量。」
translation: Each of them praised her, saying, "This is an unsurpassed happiness that brings good benefits, and it would be difficult to meet someone who hears this teaching and is devoted to it and loves it, let alone someone who takes delight in it and puts it into practice, for its virtue is incalculable."

source_sentence: 女復謂須菩提：「猶如斯地無所不忍，淨與不淨香潔臭穢不以增損。
translation: Again, the woman said to Subhūti, "Just like this ground, there's nothing intolerable about it, and its pure and impure fragrance and odor aren't added to or subtracted from it.

source_sentence: 若有行者修平等心，悉忍苦樂不以進退，猶如淨水無所不洗，淨不淨物不以憎愛。
translation: If there are practitioners who cultivate an even mind, they tolerate suffering and pleasure without advancing or retreating, just as there's nothing pure water won't wash and nothing pure or impure that they don't hate.

source_sentence: 行者如是，心猶若水，洗除眾惡三垢之穢，在於善惡不用增損。
translation: Such a practitioner's mind is like water that washes away the three defilements of evil and doesn't need to add or subtract from what's good and evil.

source_sentence: 猶若火然，在所燒盡無所去就。
translation: It's like fire, which burns up everything and leaves nothing to be desired.

source_sentence: 行者如是，消除禍福，若遭二難等無增損。
translation: Such is the practitioner who removes misfortune and fortune, and nothing is added or subtracted if he experiences two difficulties.

source_sentence: 猶若風起，在所而飄不有愛惡。
translation: He's like a wind that arises and blows where it's present without craving or ill-will.

source_sentence: 行者如是，若遇苦樂賢愚淨穢不以增損。
translation: Such a practitioner encounters pain, pleasure, goodness, foolishness, and purity without gain or loss.

source_sentence: 猶若喻空靡所不忍，空不念是忍與不忍。
translation: He's like the parable of emptiness, which tolerates nothing and isn't tolerated, and emptiness is not mindful of what's tolerated and not tolerated.

source_sentence: 行者如是，心平如空無有增損，所值善惡不以喜怒。
translation: Such is the practitioner's mind, which is level as emptiness with no increase or decrease, and which encounters good and evil without delight or anger.

source_sentence: 猶如橋船，一切眾人王者小人貧富尊卑，皆由之度無所分別。
translation: They're like a boat on a bridge, from which all people, kings, men, and noblemen, are saved without discriminating between rich and poor.

source_sentence: 行等心者亦復如是，志若橋船，無有瞋喜怨友無二。
translation: Similarly, someone who practices with this mind has the same intention as a bridge and boat, so there's no anger, joy, resentment, or friendship.

source_sentence: 明智賢士忍於凡夫，聖慧坦然心不有二。
translation: A wise and virtuous person tolerates worldlings, and noble and wise people are open-minded and don't have two minds.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 若須菩提，發起瞋恚厭恨之心，同於學士皆當忍之，不當怒報也，令不瞋恨，猶如火熾尋時滅之不當使盛。
translation: If Subhūti gives rise to anger and disgust, he should tolerate it as well as the first degree, not accepting the consequences of anger and causing it not to become angry, just as a fire that's blazing and goes out when it doesn't flourish.

source_sentence: 如是，須菩提！
translation: Thus, Supposititious Master!

source_sentence: 若貪欲興塵勞然熾，制伏其心令不馳逸，乃逮正定。」
translation: If craving arouses the dust of exertion, restrain your mind so that it doesn't become careless, and you'll then acquire right concentration."

source_sentence: 爾時，賢者須菩提問其女曰：「汝何志求而乃如是師子吼乎？」
translation: It was then that the good man Subhūti asked his daughter, "Why do you aspire to be like this, Shizi-roar?"

source_sentence: 其女答曰：「若有志求未曾能暢師子吼也，其無志求乃師子吼。
translation: The woman replied, "If someone wants to pursue it, they haven't been able to make the lion's roar before; if they don't want to pursue it, then they'll make the lion's roar.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 有所求者則墮顛倒，以墮顛倒無師子吼，有所志求便為貪身，輒墮諸見無師子吼。
translation: Those who have a wish will fall into delusion, and because they fall into delusion there's no lion's roar. Those who have a wish will then become greedy for the body, and they'll easily fall into views and no lion's roar.

source_sentence: 又賢者問：『女何志求而乃如是師子吼乎？』
translation: The good man also asks, 'What desire does a woman have to seek that makes her roar like this?'

source_sentence: 賢者何求漏盡意解？」
translation: Good man, how do you seek to end the contaminants and understand?"

source_sentence: 須菩提答女：「姊欲知之，不用志求而致解脫。」
translation: Subhūti answered the woman, "You want to know that there's no need to aspire to bring about liberation."

source_sentence: 女又答曰：「耆年本時無所志求，致得漏盡意解乎！
translation: The woman also replied, "When I was a senior, I didn't aspire to anything, so I attained liberation from the contaminants!

source_sentence: 吾亦如是逮無所逮，其法界者行無所獲。」
translation: Thus have I apprehended nothing, and those in the Dharma realm have accomplished nothing in their practice."

source_sentence: 須菩提曰：「如今觀女必志大乘終無疑也，以是之故大師子吼，舉動進止言談以類大乘之學。」
translation: Suppository said, "Now, when I look at the woman, I'm sure she'll never have any doubt about her intention for the great vehicle, and that's why the great master, the son of Pratibhāna, roars and behaves and speaks in a way that's similar to the study of the great vehicle."

source_sentence: 女又問曰：「豈能識別大乘行迹舉動進止，為何等類？」
translation: The woman also asked, "How can you tell the difference between the trajectory of the great vehicle and its mannerisms, and what kinds of things do they do?"

source_sentence: 須菩提答女曰：「聲聞雖聽，不能頒宣大乘所覩，唯女堪任敷演大乘，所行深妙廣為分別。」
translation: Suppository answered the woman, "Even though the śrāvakas listen, they can't explain what the great vehicle sees; only a woman can explain the great vehicle and discern the depth and subtlety of its practice."

source_sentence: 女曰：「賢者！
translation: The woman said, "Good man!

source_sentence: 其大乘者無所罣礙慧無陰蓋，其明無二此之謂也。
translation: "This is called the great vehicle person who has unobstructed wisdom without hindrances or hindrances, and whose insight is not two.

source_sentence: 猶日月前健行諸天，自恣無礙無能蔽者，住於虛空而飄疾行，所遊天下周遍四域，照閻浮利眾生蒙明，莫不被荷。
translation: They're like the sun and moon front gods who walk stoutly, freely, without obstruction or obscuration, abide in space, travel swiftly, and illuminate the world and pervade the four regions, so that sentient beings in Jambudvīpa are enlightened and none are entrusted with their wisdom.

source_sentence: 大乘如是正士廣學，無所罣礙無能蔽者，其心等住住無所住，其心奉行六度無極，顯示十方一切法明，故曰大乘。
translation: The great vehicle is called the great vehicle because it's thus a person of extensive training who's correct, unobstructed, unobstructed, and unhindered, whose mind equally abides in nothing, whose mind consecrates the practice of the six perfections, and who reveals the full range of dharmic illumination in the ten directions.

source_sentence: 猶轉輪王所遊行處輒居四域，菩薩大士至若干種眾生類中，在眾邪行等修慈心。
translation: Just as the wheel-turning king's processions frequently take place in four regions, the great bodhisattva goes to certain kinds of sentient beings and cultivates kindness when they engage in numerous wrong practices.

source_sentence: 其大正士如是所至到處常能獨步，沙門梵志諸天人民，郡國縣邑州域大邦利益眾生，菩薩常行四恩之業，救攝一切修若干敬。
translation: That great upright man is always alone in going to places like this, ascetics, priests, gods, people, cities, towns, states, and large countries to benefit sentient beings, and bodhisattvas always perform the four acts of kindness, saving all and cultivating various kinds of respect.

source_sentence: 故曰大乘。
translation: That's why it's called the great vehicle.

source_sentence: 諸天、龍、神、揵沓惒、阿須輪、迦留羅、真陀羅、摩休勒、釋梵四天、明智賢聖、正士聰達，以諸平等正行之無逮成真諦，所見奉敬，故曰大乘。
translation: Because gods, dragons, spirits, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, maṇḍalas, the four Śakra heavens, wise men, sages, and upright men and women venerate what they see as the true truth of equality and right practice, it's called the great vehicle.

source_sentence: 其大乘者，唯須菩提！
translation: The only one who is a great vehicle is Subhūti!

source_sentence: 而不可盡悉無所生，不斷佛教三寶之訓，諮受佛慧道法之業，奉順聖眾。
translation: "But they are inexhaustibly produced by nothing, never stopping to follow the teachings of the Three Treasures of Buddhism, consulting the karma of the Buddha's wisdom and path, and obeying the noble multitude.

source_sentence: 以大慧明勸化眾生，善具弘妙無雜碎行，所作真正解暢備悉六度無極，以四恩行救攝危厄，寂然庠序，修八正道、意止、意斷，奉無極慈修無蓋哀，堅住大道，於一切智永棄畏難，降伏眾魔捨諸闇昧，顯智慧明富眾德本，諸行具足。
translation: He encourages and educates sentient beings with the insight of great wisdom, well-equipped with the subtle and unadulterated practice of genuine understanding, fully comprehends the six perfections, saves lives in danger and distress with the four acts of kindness, conducts himself with calm dignity, cultivates the eightfold correct path, calms his thoughts, and stops his thoughts, cultivates unhindered compassion with boundless kindness, firmly abides on the great way, permanently abandons fears and difficulties with omniscience, subdues Māra, abandons darkness, reveals the source of his wisdom and wealth of virtue, and is fully equipped with all practices.

source_sentence: 諸天、人民、阿須倫所見歸命，眾魔外學莫不降伏，一切聲聞諸緣覺等，莫能當者。
translation: Gods, people, and asuras all see and give their lives to him, and none of the Māras and non-Buddhists are subdued, nor are all the śrāvakas and pratyekbuddhas capable of doing so.

source_sentence: 化眾不信令篤樂法，慈悲愍念諸懷瞋害，以布施攝慳貪，以持戒攝犯禁，以忍辱攝瞋恚，以精進攝懈怠，以一心攝亂意，以智慧攝愚癡，以財寶攝貧窮，以安和攝苦患，以歡悅從明智，故曰大乘。」
translation: He converts the unfaithful and makes them believe in the Dharma, has compassion and sympathy for those who harbor anger, subdues stinginess and greed with generosity, subdues infractions of precepts with observance of precepts, subdues anger with patience, subdues laziness with effort, subdues confusion with single-mindedness, subdues foolishness with wisdom, subdues poverty with wealth, subdues suffering with peace, and follows wisdom with joy.

source_sentence: 分衛品第三
translation: The Third Chapter of the Favored Ones

source_sentence: 於時賢者須菩提問其女曰：「快歎大乘！
translation: The good man Subhūti then asked his daughter, "Greetings, Great Vehicle!

source_sentence: 頒宣行業瑞應本末。」
translation: It's the beginning and end of the auspicious response to the promulgation of the profession."

source_sentence: 其女答曰：「正使我身一劫過劫，咨嗟大乘，不能究暢得其邊崖。
translation: The woman replied, "It's precisely because I've spent eons and eons in contemplation of the great vehicle that I haven't been able to fully understand its limits.

source_sentence: 如大乘業不可限量，其德至淳功勳名稱不可得計。」
translation: As the great vehicle's activity is unlimited, its virtue is so great that its merits and rewards are incalculable."

source_sentence: 又須菩提謂其女曰：「姊問我言：『賢者何故而行分衛？』
translation: Subhūti also said to his daughter, "You asked me, 'Good man, why are you defending yourself in this way?'

source_sentence: 如來、至真亦行分衛，從如來緣奉不違命。」
translation: The Tathāgata and Supreme Truth also conduct themselves as guardians, and from the Tathāgata's perspective, they will respect and not disobey orders."

source_sentence: 其女答曰：「唯，須菩提！
translation: The woman replied, "Yes, Subhūti!

source_sentence: 能知諸佛善權方便，欲開化眾故行分衛。」
translation: They know the buddhas' skillful means and their desire to enlighten and transform sentient beings so that they can perform defensive actions."

source_sentence: 須菩提問女：「女亦堪任諸佛若干行隨時之義，吾身不能唯說其意，修權方便行分衛乎？」
translation: Subhūti asked the woman, "Is she also capable of certain actions of the buddhas that are meant to be done at any time, but I myself can't just explain my intentions and practice defending them with expedient methods?"

source_sentence: 女復報曰：「賢者復聽，如來、至真以二十事，觀察法儀而行分衛。
translation: The woman again replied, "Good man, listen again! The Tathāgata and Zhijin perform twenty things to observe the conduct of the Dharma and guard it.

source_sentence: 何謂二十？
translation: What are the 20?

source_sentence: 一曰、現己身色形像微妙端正；二曰、順從如來分衛學法；三曰、若有眾生欲習嚴佛三十二相；四曰、觀如來身具足莊飾；五曰、如法備悉身相種好；六曰、令發無上正真道意；七曰、念於如來而行分衛，如法效之；八曰、若如來入郡國縣邑，郡國縣邑普得安隱；九曰、盲者得目悉覩諸色；十曰、聾者得聽別若干音；十一曰、心亂迷惑者伏定其意；十二曰、若裸形者得自然衣；十三曰、飢得食糧；十四曰、渴得水漿；十五曰、病者得愈；十六曰、無怒無癡；十七曰、無貪無嫉；十八曰、不恨不恚亦無自大；十九曰、心不懷惱普愍眾生；二十曰、念無央數眾生之類如身父母；是謂二十。
translation: 一曰、現己身色形像微妙端正；二曰、順從如來分衛學法；三曰、若有眾生欲習嚴佛三十二相；四曰、觀如來身具足莊飾；五曰、如法備悉身相種好；六曰、令發無上正真道意；七曰、念於如來而行分衛，如法效之；八曰、若如來入郡國縣邑，郡國縣邑普得安隱；九曰、盲者得目悉覩諸色；十曰、聾者得聽別若干音；十一曰、心亂迷惑者伏定其意；十二曰、若裸形者得自然衣；十三曰、飢得食糧；十四曰、渴得水漿；十五曰、病者得愈；十六曰、無怒無癡；十七曰、無貪無嫉；十八曰、不恨不恚亦無自大；十九曰、心不懷惱普愍眾生；二十曰、念無央數眾生之類如身父母；是謂二十。

source_sentence: 「若使如來入郡國縣邑坵聚行分衛者，令諸眾生有所見聞，發無上正真道心。
translation: "If the Tathāgata were to enter a county, town, or hillock and practice a guard, it would cause sentient beings to see and hear it and to arouse the mind of the unsurpassed true path.

source_sentence: 又，須菩提！
translation: Also, Subhūti!

source_sentence: 世尊大哀，來化眾生無數眾苦，悉至三界隨時救護，如來現義因得自在故行分衛。
translation: The Bhagavān is greatly compassionate, comes to convert sentient beings from innumerable sufferings, reaches all three realms at any time, and acts as a protector because the Tathāgata has gained mastery over his present meaning.

source_sentence: 「唯，須菩提！
translation: "Yes, Subhūti!

source_sentence: 如來所入郡國縣邑行分衛時，無數諸天、龍、神、揵沓惒、何須倫、迦留羅、真陀羅、摩休勒、釋梵四王，皆隨侍之奉事供養，承佛威神皆發道心。
translation: When the Tathāgata entered the prefectures and cities and traveled to their borders, countless gods, dragons, gods, gandharvas, hesshuras, garuḍas, maṇḍalas, and the four Śākyamuni kings accompanied him, served him, and made offerings, and they all arouse the attitude of enlightenment in response to the Buddha's authority.

source_sentence: 「又，須菩提！
translation: "And, Subhūti!

source_sentence: 諸天、龍、神、釋梵四王，供養如來，見如來身，道明無邊寂然庠序，心自念言：『至未曾有，如來、至真所宣正典我等諮受，所奉經法愛樂自歸。
translation: The gods, dragons, gods, and the four kings of Indra and Brahmā make offerings to the Tathāgata, and when they see the Tathāgata's body, their awareness of the path's limitless tranquility and zealousness, they think to themselves, 'Never has there been a time when we've consulted the correct sūtras proclaimed by the Tathāgata and Supreme Truth and have loved and taken refuge in the teachings they've received.

source_sentence: 如來、至真發大道心，以是之故而行分衛。』
translation: The Tathāgata and Zhijin have aroused the mind of the great way, and it's for this reason that they conduct their part in safeguarding it."

source_sentence: 「唯，須菩提！
translation: "Yes, Subhūti!

source_sentence: 如來分衛無數眾人，慕官貪士好財志豪，求端正色欲多眷屬，見佛世尊捨轉輪王出家為道，心自念言：『覩佛大哀詣貧匱家而行分衛，棄世榮祿發無上正真道意，故行分衛。』
translation: The Tathāgata guards countless people who admire government officials, covet men, are wealthy, have great ambitions, and seek proper sexual desires, and have many dependents. When they see the Bhagavān abandon the wheel-turning king and leave home to follow the path, they think to themselves, 'Look at the Buddha's great compassion as he goes to a poor and destitute family and guards them, forsaking worldly glory and riches and arousing the intention for the unsurpassed true path, so they practice guarding them.'

source_sentence: 「唯，須菩提！
translation: "Yes, Subhūti!

source_sentence: 諸大尊神、天子、梵天，承佛威神觀見如來，心自念言：『如來常充未曾飢渴，用愍眾生故與眷屬而行分衛，我等慕樂夙夜精進，成至正覺，與眷屬俱而行分衛。』
translation: The great honored deities, gods, sons, and brahmas who observed the Tathāgata because of the Buddha's authoritative power said to themselves, 'The Tathāgata is always full, never hungry or thirsty, and because of his compassion for sentient beings, he conducts his retinue with his retinue, and we long for the joy of making effort day and night to achieve perfect awakening and conduct our retinue with our retinue.'

source_sentence: 作是念已，發大道意。
translation: After this thought, he arouses the great intention.

source_sentence: 「唯，須菩提！
translation: "Yes, Subhūti!

source_sentence: 若懈怠眾懶惰不勤，見於如來入郡國縣邑州域大邦，心中歡悅稽首自歸，發平等心慕最正覺。
translation: If lazy people are indolent and don't work hard, then when they see the Tathāgata enter a county, town, region, or large state, they rejoice in their hearts, bow their heads, and arouse an equal mind to adore the Most Perfectly Enlightened One.

source_sentence: 「唯，須菩提！
translation: "Yes, Subhūti!

source_sentence: 見諸佛尊終不虛妄，眾人覩聞其音響者，一發意頃以為道本，因是究竟得至滅度，以故如來而行分衛。
translation: Seeing that the buddhas are never false and that people see and hear their sounds, a single thought arises that takes it as the basis of the path, and because of that it's ultimately possible to reach total cessation, and therefore the Tathāgata conducts his part of the defense.

source_sentence: 「唯，須菩提！
translation: "Yes, Subhūti!

source_sentence: 如來入郡國縣邑，諸在繫縛閉在牢獄而得解脫，眾生若聞如來名號，承其聖旨自然得解，欲報慈恩發無上正真道意，以是之故而現分衛。
translation: The Tathāgata enters cities and towns, fetters fetters, closes prisons, and attains liberation, and if sentient beings hear the Tathāgata's name and accept his noble teaching, they naturally attain liberation and want to repay kindness by arousing the intention for the unsurpassed true path; therefore, they are presented as guardians.

source_sentence: 「唯，須菩提！
translation: "Yes, Subhūti!

source_sentence: 族姓子、族姓女若聞如來功勳之德，歎詠名稱適承其號，奉上如來餚饍異味，衣被床臥及他異供，敬護父母兄弟姊妹、夫婦子孫，若無因緣，不得故往奉見如來，以故如來入於郡國縣邑而行分衛，心懷踊躍貢上供養，皆發無上正真道意。
translation: If clansmen and clanswomen hear about the merits of the Tathāgata's achievements, praise his name, appropriately acknowledge his title, present the Tathāgata with different foods and foods, make different offerings of clothing, bedding, and other things, honor their parents, brothers, sisters, husbands, wives, children, and grandchildren, and couldn't go to see the Tathāgata without a cause and condition, then the Tathāgata enters a county or town, makes assurances, and rouses their hearts to make offerings, they'll all awaken the true intention of the unsurpassed path.

source_sentence: 「唯，須菩提！
translation: "Yes, Subhūti!

source_sentence: 其四天王奉如來鉢，若貧窮眾少於財寶欲薄布施者，見如來鉢自然而滿；大財富者欲廣施者，見如來鉢空因供施佛，皆發無上正真道意，以故如來現行分衛。
translation: When those four heavenly kings present the Tathāgata's bowl, poor people who want to give little in terms of possessions and treasures see the Tathāgata's bowl naturally fill it, and wealthy people who want to give generously see the Tathāgata's bowl empty and offer it to the Buddha, and they all arouse the intention for the unsurpassed true path, which is why the Tathāgata currently guards it.

source_sentence: 「唯，須菩提！
translation: "Yes, Subhūti!

source_sentence: 假使如來取若干饍悉齊合著，百千億鉢還著一鉢，不令雜錯各如本故，無數諸天、龍、神、揵沓惒、阿須倫、迦留羅、真陀羅、摩休勒，覩於如來變化示現，得未曾有善心生矣，皆發無上正真道意，以是之故而行分衛。
translation: Suppose the Tathāgata were to take a certain amount of food and combine it all together, returning a hundred billion bowls to one bowl so that nothing is mixed up with the original, then countless gods, dragons, spirits, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, maṇḍalas, and mahoras would see the Tathāgata's miraculous manifestations and attain unprecedented goodness of mind, and they'd all arouse the intention to practice the unsurpassed true path and guard it because of that.

source_sentence: 「唯，須菩提！
translation: "Yes, Subhūti!

source_sentence: 如來身者金剛之數無量福會，如來身者無有生藏及與熟藏，亦無不淨大小之便，不用飢渴而行分衛，現有所食不覩所入，而見如來，顯明大慧真正之法皆發道意。
translation: "The Tathāgata's body is an adamantine mass of measureless merit, the Tathāgata's body has no store of birth or maturation, no impure or large stools, he doesn't need to go hungry or thirsty to guard his body, and he sees the Tathāgata without seeing or entering anything in the present, which shows that the true teaching of great wisdom arouses the intention for enlightenment.

source_sentence: 「又，須菩提！
translation: "And, Subhūti!

source_sentence: 若有眾生施如來食，多少麁細甘美不好，所貢上饍在於如來，所種德本所立福祐，不可限量無有邊際，況復廣施受天人福，眾祐不盡至得滅度，以是之故而行分衛。
translation: If sentient beings give food to the Tathāgata, whether it's crude or fine, sweet or not, and the superior food they give is from the Tathāgata, the virtues they cultivate and the blessings they receive are unlimited and have no limit, and they also give generously to receive the blessings of gods and humans, so that their blessings don't end until they are liberated, they'll practice defending themselves because of that.

source_sentence: 「又，須菩提！
translation: "Furthermore, Subhūti!

source_sentence: 如來一定三昧正受，無數神尊諸天子等，眾梵天王色行天子，見於如來而行分衛不捨三昧，心自念言：『今佛愍哀眾生之故，而行乞食不用飢乏，諸天人民覩斯義利皆發道意，以故如來現行分衛。』
translation: When the Tathāgata's certain samādhi was correctly experienced, countless gods, gods, and other celestials, including the Brahmakāyika gods and goddesses of form and action, saw the Tathāgata practicing the samādhi of partial protection and not abandoning it, and they thought to themselves, 'Now, the Buddha pities sentient beings and goes about begging for food without starvation, and the gods and people who see this benefit all arouse the intention to follow the Way; therefore, the Tathāgata is currently performing partial protection.'

source_sentence: 「又，須菩提！
translation: "And, Subhūti!

source_sentence: 如來常懷賢聖自在而行分衛，無有貪嫉亦不飲食，為諸信者，頒宣經道，令出家學，化族姓子女故行分衛。
translation: "The Tathāgata always conducts himself with the sovereignty of the noble ones in mind, has no craving or jealousy, doesn't eat or drink, and conducts himself for the sake of faithful people by proclaiming the sūtras and path, causing them to leave home and train, and teaching the children of their clans.

source_sentence: 未曾飲食其飢饉者，不能自致至於道德，欲令此等所願具足，故顯分衛。
translation: Those who have never eaten or starved cannot bring themselves to attain virtue, and they want to fulfill these desires, so they show their part in defending them.

source_sentence: 「又，須菩提！
translation: "And, Subhūti!

source_sentence: 如來執懷賢聖自行分衛，救諸不賢濟眾罣礙使無所著，令興大道至無極慧。
translation: The Tathāgata's attachment to the wisdom of the noble ones is self-defense, saving the unwise and relieving the many obstacles so that they don't become attached, and causing the great path to flourish until it reaches the supreme insight.

source_sentence: 「又，須菩提！
translation: "And, Subhūti!

source_sentence: 如來愍念將來之世邊地諸國，故行分衛，得無後世不信道法長者梵志，心自念言：『此等聖師不行分衛，弟子何故橫行乞食？』
translation: The Tathāgata's pity for the countries in the borderlands in a future age led him to practice defending himself so that there wouldn't be any future generations of priests who didn't believe in the way and priests who thought to themselves, 'Why didn't these noble teachers practice defending themselves, so why would a disciple go begging for food?'

source_sentence: 見諸比丘及比丘尼懷恚不喜。
translation: Seeing the monks and nuns, they harbored anger and displeasure.

source_sentence: 由是之故，佛現分衛。
translation: Because of this, the Buddha now shows up as a part-keeper.

source_sentence: 心自念言：『佛無上尊愍眾分衛，弟子法之因供咨嗟，手自斟酌施與比丘，此等學士承佛至教而行分衛。』
translation: He thinks to himself, 'The Buddha's unsurpassed kindness to all the people is shared, and the disciples make offerings and sighs of praise because of the teaching, and they give their own discretionary gifts to the monks, for those who accept the Buddha's supreme teaching and conduct their share of guarding.'

source_sentence: 見之欣然，供養一切比丘、比丘尼。
translation: They were delighted by what they saw and made offerings to all the monks and nuns.

source_sentence: 以故如來而現分衛。
translation: That's why the Tathāgata shows up as a part-keeper.

source_sentence: 「又，須菩提！
translation: "And, Subhūti!

source_sentence: 諸王帝主、太子、長者、梵志、大臣、百官諸子，見於如來、無上正真不乞食者，若有眾人信樂道法，棄家行學而作沙門恥於分衛：『我等家門姓貴豪尊出為沙門，反從庶民貧家下劣乞分衛乎？』
translation: If kings, emperors, princes, elders, priests, ministers, or the sons of a hundred officials see the Tathāgata, the unsurpassed true one, and don't solicit alms, then suppose there are people who believe in the Way, abandon their homes and training, and become ascetics ashamed to share the guard: 'My family, noble and distinguished, went out to become ascetics, but we've come from a poor family of common people and inferior people to solicit a share of the guard?'

source_sentence: 以故如來現行分衛。
translation: That's why the Tathāgata is currently defending them.

source_sentence: 心自念言：『如來大德猶如虛空，愍行分衛，況我等乎？
translation: They think to themselves, 'The Tathāgata's great virtue is like space, compassionately acting as a guard, so why wouldn't it be us?'

source_sentence: 念此不慚，哀諸下劣，樂行分衛。』
translation: Mindful of this lack of conscience, they sympathize with the inferior and delight in practicing shared defense.'

source_sentence: 「又，須菩提！
translation: "And, Subhūti!

source_sentence: 如來普隨世間習俗而勸化之，因其勸樂各從眾生，應受化律而授道教，如來各隨而建立之，緣其方便未曾飢虛，無有眾患飢渴之難，不以羸劣，無有慳嫉，無有眾惡，決諸疑網。
translation: The Tathāgata encourages and teaches the world according to its customs, follows the guidance of sentient beings because of their encouragement, confers the precepts and teaches the path according to their transformation, establishes each according to its skillful means, never starves, has no difficulty with hunger and thirst, isn't debilitated, isn't stingy, isn't cynical, doesn't have many evils, and resolves webs of doubt.

source_sentence: 如是，須菩提！
translation: Thus, Subhūti!

source_sentence: 如來以此無量方便欲救眾生，故行分衛，度眾闇塞使見道明。」
translation: Because the Tathāgata wants to save sentient beings with these measureless methods, he acts as a partisan to save them from the darkness and make them see the path clearly."

source_sentence: 女謂須菩提：「賢者寧能以是隨時方便用斯大哀，如此眾祐，建修清淨，行分衛乎？」
translation: The woman said to Subhūti, "Good man, how could you use this great compassion with such ready skillful means to build and purify such multitudes of blessings and practice partial protection?"

source_sentence: 須菩提答曰：「姊！
translation: Subhūti replied, "Sister!

source_sentence: 我不堪任，猶如一切野狐狸兔眾鹿尛蟲，不能當任師子獸王，不能獨步，而現其前師子吼也。
translation: I'm not up to the task, like all the wild foxes, rabbits, rabbits, deer, and insects that can't serve as lion king of animals and can't step out on my own and make known the lion's roar.

source_sentence: 如是一切聲聞、緣覺之乘，不任如來威神禮節善權方便，普安一切大慈大哀。」
translation: Thus, all the vehicles of śrāvakas and pratyekbuddhas aren't capable of the Tathāgata's dignified conduct, good authority, and skillful means, which universally pacify them all with great kindness and compassion."

source_sentence: 女說此善權方便如來大哀時，其女父母長者，家中大小及餘長者，來入舍中聞所說法，二萬八千人，皆發無上正真道意。
translation: When the woman spoke this great compassion of the Tathāgata in terms of skillful means, her parents, the elders of her household, and other elders came into the monastery to hear what was being taught, and 28,000 of them aroused the intention for the unsurpassed true path.

source_sentence: 順權方便經卷上
translation: Shōkyō kyōkyō kyōshō shōkyō kyōshō shōkyō kyōkai shōshō
